attributes.action: Legalise assisted dying for terminal illnesses.
attributes.background: It's wrong that doctors have to keep alive people who are in either serious physical or mental distress when they wish to end their own lives.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone should be able to do whatever they want with their own lives. We're all supposed to live in a country where we supposedly have pure freedom. People can't end their lives if their life is a horror every day.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the Eurasian lynx as soon as possible.
attributes.background: There are 1.5 million deer in the UK, which is a massive overpopulation. They are overgrazing our woodlands causing a significant loss in biodiversity. Reintroducing the lynx would be a long-term solution to this issue and would restore balance to the UK's ecosystems.
attributes.additional_details: The Lynx UK Trust published research documents about a lynx reintroduction in 2015. It is now 2018 and no action has been taken by the government. Our country is one of the most nature-depleted countries in the world, with 53% of our species in decline. I would suggest that the lynx be reintroduced within 1 year of this petition receiving 10,000 signatures, as we need to act fast. If you want to read more go to The Lynx UK Trust's website. The Government should approve the reintroduction licence as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Increase benefits to the average cost of living for all UC claims
attributes.background:
Being on benefits especially the new Universal Credit is now making financial problems for people on benefits. 
By March 2023 everyone will be claiming universal credit. The cost of living is massively higher than benefits MOST people receive. 
UC should be evened out whether you are 25 or not.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.moneyadviceservice.org.uk/en/articles/paying-your-own-way 
- Concludes the average household living cost.
 
https://www.gov.uk/universal-credit/what-youll-get 
-Shows what you will get if you are on UC 
 
It should not make a difference how old you are, there are a lot of families out there younger than 25 and the gap between the monthly payments are quite large vary age.

attributes.action: Stop insurers charging interest on monthly payments for motor premiums.
attributes.background: When taking out a motor insurance policy, you either pay for their premiums annually or monthly. However, often, monthly premiums attract high interest rates, making insurance more expensive. This is penalising low income families who can't afford to pay annually.
attributes.additional_details:
The Road Traffic Act 1930 made it a legal requirement to hold a valid motor insurance policy if you drive a car on the public highway with at least third party cover. However, many on lower incomes, who rely on their car, have no choice but to pay monthly and therefore penalised with interest loaded on. The law should be changed so they cannot add interest. 

Insurers say it costs to process monthly payments, but considering Direct Line Group, for example, made a £293.8m pre-tax profit in the first half of 2018 (https://www.directlinegroup.com/~/media/Files/D/Direct-Line-Group-V2/reports-and-presentations/h1-results-2018-annoucement.pdf), it's unfair.

attributes.action: Improvement of animal welfare labelling on all animal or animal produce products
attributes.background: Displaying shocking pictures like that on smoking packets of the welfare standards for the worse welfare foods and a rated system on all animal produce/meat foods. Legal labelling for all foods and restaurants including foods incorporating meat or produce.
attributes.additional_details: Our labelling of meat sold in supermarkets is awful. We have the red tractor and we have RSPCA assured. I am very annoyed that we still sell caged chicken eggs, why? To save the consumer a matter of pence, at the detriment to the animal, then you have “free range” which doesn’t always mean that their welfare is higher than that of a caged chicken.

attributes.action: To make Party political Manifestos legally binding once elected.
attributes.background: Parties of all political persuasions have attempted to gain votes  by making headline gestures that they can save millions, they then renege on this pledge. This petition is trying to seek full transparency on manifestos and exactly how they will be implemented by financially backing their claims.
attributes.additional_details: Whether its student fees, the NHS, Police, immigration or universal credit. This debate should it happen will focus all political parties to sound out financial and political options; before making manifesto statements. This will show that the parties are 100% certain that they can implement and fully back up their claims. Additionally a penalty system would need to be proposed for those who do not carry out the manifesto pledge are duly summoned to public recourse and/or financial penalty.

attributes.action: Consistently implement the Metric System across the UK
attributes.background: The Metric system has only been partially integrated into public life. We measure fuel in litres, speed in mph. Government policy is beer is sold in pints, while other alcohol such as spirits & wine to be sold in litres & ml. The government should implement the metric system in all law & regulation.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrepancy in selling of alcohol:
https://www.gov.uk/weights-measures-and-packaging-the-law/specified-quantities

Examples (as recent as 2000 in the UK) of where conversion errors have caused issues with infrastructure and technology:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-27509559

Inconsistency in non metric measurements - the difference between UK and US Imperial measurements:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/skillswise/factsheet/ma21impe-l1-f-converting-imperial-and-metric

attributes.action: Hold banks properly to account over negligent handling of bank card fraud claims
attributes.background:
Banks are currently allowed to deny card fraud claims without providing evidence for their decision to customers.

They are not protecting our money and personal data from card fraud. At a time when large companies suffer mass data breaches this is not acceptable behaviour and should be penalised.
attributes.additional_details:
Banks avoid reimbursing the value of stolen funds, or compensating victims of bank fraud, not least because the Police, Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and Financial Ombudsman Service (FOS) are under-resourced and unable to cope with a growing epidemic of digital crime.

Government should:

- ask the FCA to conduct an investigation into this issue;
- amend the law to allow the FCA or FOS to issue fines in individual cases; and
- better resource the Ombudsman to conduct further investigations.

attributes.action: Not pay foreign aid to countries that possess nuclear weapons
attributes.background: If a country possess nuclear weapons it is in no need of British charity. Donating foreign aid to countries that possess nuclear weapons is a slap in the face of British tax payers.

attributes.action: Protect British food and drink in future trade deals
attributes.background: I would like the Government to act now and introduce legislation that ensures protected designation of origin (PDO), protected geographical indication (PGI), and traditional specialities guaranteed (TSG), remain a part of the British food and drink industry post Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: I urge you to back British business and sign our petition that will help promote our vital food and drink industries.

attributes.action: Pull out from and cut all UK taxpayer funding to the UN Human Rights Council
attributes.background: The Council has clearly become a platform for countries with worst rights records to whitewash themselves, as evidenced by the lack of a single resolution on the countries that run it. It is therefore a moral obligation to stop legitimising this travesty.
attributes.additional_details: According to its mission statement, UN HRC is "responsible for strengthening the promotion and protection of human rights around the globe and for addressing situations of human rights violations." It is also empowered to investigate alleged human rights abuses of UN member states. The watchdog's makeup includes Venezuela, China, Qatar, Angola, Pakistan, DR Congo, Cuba, Afghanistan and Saudi Arabia, with Somalia, Bangladesh and Eritrea most recently joining the rest.

attributes.action: Change 30 hours free child care eligible 51 weeks a year instead of term time
attributes.background: Current funding of 30 free hours only covers term time which for most working parents only actually covers maybe a day and a half child care as like me most work full time meaning if you have more then 1 child costs soon add up.  get the government to change 30hours free a week not just in term

attributes.action: Ban cot bumpers and baby sleeping aids from being sold in the UK
attributes.background:
Every year babies die in cots where parents use bumpers and positional sleeping aids. These deaths are unnecessary and many are avoidable. 

The recommendations for safe sleep do not include these items and many parents are misinformed in the safety of these.

attributes.action: To change the Gambling Act to protect minors from loot boxes in computer games.
attributes.background: Games companies are making poor quality games to maximize player spending. Players are gambling real world currency, by exchanging it for virtual currency to play built in slot machines. There are match making algorithms to match weaker players with better ones.
attributes.additional_details:
This will make the weaker player jealous, tempting them to gambling money on the loot boxes on the pay-to-win game. Gambling can be addictive, and children are more susceptible to being addicted. All the transactions and electronically automated, so children with no concept of money will keep opening loot boxes. It's a very scummy, shady tactic used by some games companies. And it's typically the case that the only thing you can buy in the game is solely the virtual currency for opening loot boxes in one game mode
 
Please sign

attributes.action: Better treatment for NHS dialysis patients
attributes.background:
Government figures. I If a patient enters dialysis after the age of 
70to 75 life expectancy is 1 to 2 years. I entered at the age of 82 I am now in my 7th year.
attributes.additional_details:
Kidney failure
This petition could apply to any person of any age. 
I never had kidney failure, I had two operations 12 years apart each operation killed one kidney. 	 
I diagnosed myself and informed the doctor in writing more than a dozen times when I had a closure of an artery,  
There is a system for detecting closures it’s called a transonic flow meter it is used on patients once every three months? 
My petition is for the flow meter to be used on the patient four times a month with a minimum of twice a month.
It will mean patients living longer but that is what nursing is all about? 
Please sign this petition, you will be helping others and by unfortunate chance you might be helping your self.

attributes.action: Routinely arm all UK Police Officers.
attributes.background:
The British Police face numerous threats including terrorists, robbers, drug dealers, in addition to the growing numbers teenagers who now regularly carry knives.

These individuals have no fear, do not value life and would not think twice about shooting or stabbing an unarmed Police Officer.

attributes.action: Urge Bank of England to return to traditional 'paper' banknotes
attributes.background: Keep existing 'paper* £20 & £50 and recall existing polymer notes. The public prefer beautiful 'paper' banknotes.
attributes.additional_details:
*Paper money: Traditionally manufactured textile-mix notes of folding currency; such as the US Dollar (75% cotton 25% linen). {as compared to polymer i.e. plastic notes - introduced to UK circulation Sep' 2016}

Polymer banknotes are not worthy of the dignity of a national currency.
Slippery to the touch and handle.
Prone to flying out of control, e.g. from wallet or the hand.
Unpredictably stick together. 
Will not fold or stay folded, to store easily in
wallets/pockets etc.
Don't sit securely within cash-till draws.
Difficult to count up - on a table the notes will not stack up, they slide away in disorder and bounce about.
Alternative security features are available to make 'paper'-notes as secure.

attributes.action: Make all UK schools take GCSEs
attributes.background:
If you attend a state school now, you must take GCSEs 9-1. But if you are more privileged and go to a private school, you can take IGCSEs. 
IGCSEs can be easier than the new GCSEs 9-1 but are considered as equal levels of education. Should the rich be able to pay for easier qualifications?
attributes.additional_details:
Take English Literature for example, at IGCSE level, it's not totally closed book and you have the option to have 40% coursework. Not to mention the added 20% mark for speaking! Whereas at GCSE 9-1 level, exams are worth 100% of your grade and it's fully closed book - you must remember lots of quotes. 

Surely everyone has the right to take equal tests for equal qualifications?

http://everythingenglisheducation.co.uk/everything-english-education-gcse-reforms-igcse-versus-gcse-guess-who-wins/”

attributes.action: Make Michaelmas Day (29th September) a public holiday.
attributes.background:
Michaelmas (Mickle-mas) was The Feast of St Michael and was used to celebrate the final harvest.  Everything that couldn't be preserved was eaten in a great feast.

This holiday would be a dress rehearsal for Christmas, minus the relatives and presents!

attributes.action: Require fire evacuation and lockdown drills in UK schools and colleges
attributes.background: I am very interested in health and safety and I want to feel like I make a difference to this country by making our schools and colleges a safer environment for staff and students by carrying out fire evacuations termly and a lockdown procedure test at least once a year.

attributes.action: Safeguard School Milk Funding Post-Brexit
attributes.background: With funding for the EU School Milk Scheme under consideration, and the Nursery Milk Scheme being consulted on, millions of children may be at risk of missing out on milk that generations before them received. We're calling on the Government to commit to funding a replacement scheme post-Brexit

attributes.action: Ban Saturday school in all private schools to make the systems fair
attributes.background: Many private schools have Saturday school and many others don’t. Saturday school is a huge effort and much more money for parents to spend on their education. As a student you need rest and Saturday school does not allow this.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of homework received by primary school students.
attributes.background: Being a student myself, I know the struggle. Children in primary education receive an unnecessary amount of homework each week, and need to be enjoying their childhood, and being more active. The only important homework is reading and spellings.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the homework they receive is sometimes difficult to understand, and not always relevant to their learning. Not only do the students feel pressurised at such a young age, but it can also cause conflict at home between the student and their parents. This is due to the parents also feeling stressed.

attributes.action: Make schools provide 20 mins planned exercise each day to tackle rising obesity.
attributes.background:
Planned exercise should be fun, incorporating lifestyle / healthy eating guidance:
- Prevention is better than cure / better than keep bemoaning pressure on NHS etc
- Learning at school should be about whole person and their future life chances, not just the constraints of the curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
This should be in ALL schools. In primary schools the data from the National Child Measurement Programme could be used to measure progress.
Educational attainment would be expected to increase as a result.

Some factors:
- Screen time: video games, mobiles etc
- Taxi of Mum/Dad
- Over-protective parents limiting kids' freedom to roam
- Erosion of PE time in primary schools by pressure of needing academic success for league tables
- Erosion of play/break times and dinner time by same pressure

attributes.action: Scrap Vehicle Excise Duty and raise excise duty on fuel.
attributes.background: Instead of wasting valuable police resources chasing untaxed drivers, when they should be tackling more serious crime, scrap VED and add 10 pence to the price of a litre of fuel. That way, the more you drive the more you pay.
attributes.additional_details: We all know that manufacturer's fuel consumption figures are very unreliable. This way people will pay the fair amount due in tax based on their consumption and their mileage. It doesn't penalise the drivers who have to have a car because bus services in their rural area are non- existent and without a car they wouldn't be able to get to hospitals for appointments or to the shop for essentials.

attributes.action: Require all dog breeders to keep a correct record of Dogs chipped and sold on.
attributes.background: Today 5 Dogs caught as strays....have a chip no. but either not registered or no longer a current contact.

attributes.action: Ensure school curriculum includes educating students on crime and consequences
attributes.background: Crime at young ages affects everyone in the community. It affects the offender as they should be learning and that is postponed or permanently stopped. It would affect the victim as it would affect any victim mentally. It will also affect the community as a whole, making the area look atrocious.

attributes.action: Up grade the A34 to motorway standard.
attributes.background: The A34 is a major road linking motorways, it regularly suffers from road closures due to accidents. These affect the economy and cause major problems on surrounding roads as there is no suitable alternative route.  It has been stated by numerous people that the A34 is no longer fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Create a governing body to regulate private landlords to protect tenants
attributes.background: Too many private landlords do not carry out their legal obligations at the detriment of their tenants. A governing body is required to regulate such requirements and support tenants whom need to report such landlords for not meeting safety & obligatory maintenance and to investigate harrassment
attributes.additional_details: If you have been subjected to unsafe living conditions, patronising responses, lack of communication and no action taken on much needed property repairs and/or maintenance, then a regulating body is required to fully investigate in depth. Local authorities currently do not have enough capacity to assist with such needs across the UK.

attributes.action: Ban the use of full names in GP or hospital waiting rooms
attributes.background: Confidentiality is up most important in settings such as GP surgeries and hospitals. Data protection laws are tougher now than ever. However they don’t seem to apply when in a waiting room, the professional will call you through by using your full name in front of other people.
attributes.additional_details: I am starting this petition after a prisoner attached to their guard in a waiting room was called through for his appointment. All it took was for me to google their name and gather information as to why they were in prison, how long their sentence was and their address. People’s identities should be protected in GP and hospital waiting rooms.

attributes.action: Scrap the CQC as an onerous bombastic regulation lead organisation
attributes.background: The CQC and its predecessors have developed this watch dog role since 2004, and it’s worth asking what if anything, these state appointed monitors have contributed to health and social care during that time, apart from undermining leadership and interrupting health care delivery.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the CQC have made clear mistakes over recent years. It is clear that they are unlikely to change their methodology and a majority of health care professionals across the country think they are not fit for purpose, and wish to see a change in the way health and social care is regulated.

attributes.action: Ban night shift working, for the sake of the health of workers
attributes.background: Studies have established that the health of workers in the UK is directly negatively affected by night shift working. I ask Parliament to hold a debate over this practice. Why are hard-working people being made to suffer unnecessarily, and why does the Health and Safety at Work Act not protect them?
attributes.additional_details: Long-term night shift work is associated with an increased risk of certain cancers, as well as metabolic problems, heart disease, ulcers and gastrointestinal problems. People who work night shifts or rotating shifts often don't sleep enough. Long-term sleep deprivation is known to be bad for health. Statistics show that a large amount of UK workers are shift workers and, in particular, night shift workers.

attributes.action: Dual the entire route of the A47
attributes.background: Tens of thousands of vehicles use the A47 every year. It is one of the most important roads in the UK more specifically the East of England. The route is also used by numerous logistics companies. However there are also hundreds of accidents every   causing confusion and delay.

attributes.action: Stop Cat D (open prisons) holding sex offenders within 5 miles of any school.
attributes.background: Safety for all our children. An open prison means prisoners can leave prison unescorted. Being near any school I feel this is asking for trouble and very dangerous.

attributes.action: The United Kingdom should have its very own  Interstellar Space Force.
attributes.background: In order to maintain close ties with our greatest ally, the United States, I call upon the UK government to pledge to the nation that we will introduce a bill for the establishment of a new branch of the Armed Forces - our very own Space Force.
attributes.additional_details: We just need it.

attributes.action: Stop the state pension reducing tax allowances for working pensioners
attributes.background: Many people remain in work beyond retirement age training the next generation. Some work because they need to top up their income rather than turn to the state for benefits. Decreasing tax codes re-taxes PAYBACK of money already paid in tax. This was not an investment but saving.
attributes.additional_details: What the government should do is change the law so the state pension doesn't count towards someone's personal tax allowance if they are working. Having completed one working career paying for that pension, the government should allow people to continue to work without having their tax code reduced. This double tax on pensions puts people off continuing to contribute to society. The well being of remaining part time in work reduces a burden on the state. State pension is a PAYBACK and not an additional income!

attributes.action: Make it a law that every work place need to supply air conditioning units.
attributes.background: Every work place now won’t supply air conditioning as it’s not Essential however if we made it a law many schools, nursurys and work places would Benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no law which says you have to go home just that your work place has to supply water. 
Let’s make a change!

attributes.action: Make more council houses available for part rent, part buy
attributes.background: I'm a working dad of 2 children under 2 year old. Me and my partner can't afford to live together as I don't earn enough to support us and pay private rent. The Government should introduce a scheme to make more council homes available for families to part rent part buy to get on the property ladder.
attributes.additional_details: More and more families are struggling to live together with young children. My children are 14 month old and a 2 week old. Like a lot of families me and my partner can’t afford to live together as I work full time and she doesn't as she raises the children. The systems we have in this country don't help people who work. Help to buy is only good if you can afford to save but with young children and paying rent that's more than a mortgage, it's hard to save.

attributes.action: Provide a minimum of 100 litres of clean water per person daily, free of charge
attributes.background:
Water supply is fast becoming one of the most expensive utilities.
I believe every UK citizen should be entitled to a minimum amount, supplied free of charge by all regional water companies, enough to provide the basic human needs and maintain health and hygiene at a good standard.
attributes.additional_details:
Water is now an expensive commodity.
There is no option of choice of supplier in the water supply industry for private households.
Water is a life essential and any modern country should be required to provide a minimum amount free of charge to maintain health in the population.

attributes.action: To review current criminal law relating to rape and sexual offences.
attributes.background:
I would like the government to review current law and to implement a 3-point plan.

Educate - To make sexual education compulsory in all Secondary schools.
Prevent - Increased awareness around high-risk areas (nightclubs, pubs etc).
Prosecute - Increase current minimum term guideline for crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe more can be done to reduce crime relating to rape and sexual offences. I am constantly heartbroken, daily, to read about it on the news. The crime is unforgivable and I think we have a duty as a society to call for more action which will protect the general public. 

- Approximately 85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year.
- Rape Crisis specialist services were accessed by 78,461 individuals an increase of 17% from 2016-17.

attributes.action: Give cadet forces more funding + get all air cadets squadrons back in the sky.
attributes.background: Cadet funding is low, especially in areas such as the Thongsbridge detachment, as their cadet building is more of a mobile home than a building. Furthermore, more than half of the air cadet forces have had their volountier glider squadrons disbanded, meaning these air cadets can no longer fly planes
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/03/19/air-cadet-cuts-will-see-more-than-half-of-squadrons-axed/ - air cadets grounded evidence

https://armycadets.com/about-us/acf-structure/the-acfa/about-acfa/acfa-funding/ - Cadets are currently charity funded

https://www.sea-cadets.org/how-were-funded - sea cadets are funded by the individual cadets and fundraising

More cadet funding will help improve the cadet forces, teaching young people great skills and getting more kids off the streets.

attributes.action: Registration with the charities commission be mandatory for religious bodies.
attributes.background: We need to ensure all religious organisations collecting money are registered with the charities commission. Therefore they must publish their accounts and be willing to have them independently audited for fraud and questionable use of money.

attributes.action: Make fire extinguishers mandatory in tower blocks
attributes.background: Many tower blocks don’t have the minimum safety in case a fire occurs and to prevent any further accident to spread, there should be a law forcing tower blocks to have fire extinguishers

attributes.action: It should be mandatory for schools to provide a summer uniform
attributes.background: Schools should have to provide a summer uniform for its students such as shorts, and a polo shirt or similar. This would help people concentrate in lessons because they wouldn’t be overly hot, like I was this summer.

attributes.action: Discontinue Pay As You Dine and Reinstate Monthly Food Charges
attributes.background: Before Pay As You Dine British servicemen and women were charged a monthly food cost paid from their wages automatically, this ensured every soldier had 3 meals per day should they choose to eat at the cook house, since Payd came in the food quality has dropped dramatically, time to change!
attributes.additional_details:
Also because of lack of education and poor management a small population of soldiers have been put in a position where they cannot afford to eat, leaving the option to go “Hungry Soldier” this is incredibly degrading and embarrassing 

Discontinuing PAYD would be so much more beneficial for the servicemen of our country on a number of fronts

Things have to change

attributes.action: Allow fathers in employment to have time off for scans and parenting classes
attributes.background: First time dad. Gov.co.uk states maximum two appointments for scans etc. Employers shouldn’t be allowed to force dads to use their holidays for scan appointments. As fathers we should be allowed every appointment off work.
attributes.additional_details: My partner and I have to go to various hospitals for scans to ensure everything is right. I must use my holiday hours. I can take time off for a doctors or hospital appointment, because it's for me but I can’t have time off for scans because it's not directly for me! Slight discrimination!”

attributes.action: Government funding for free public transport for stage 4 cancer patients.
attributes.background:
There should be free public transport for people under pension age who have stage 4 cancer, or similarly life-shortening illnesses.
This entitlement will end at pension age to be replaced by the freedom pass.
attributes.additional_details: Those diagnosed with life-shortening illnesses will not have the opportunity to use free public transport for as long as the rest of the public on average.

attributes.action: Add recycling to the curriculum. Even if it's 1 day a year - possibly a visit.
attributes.background:
Incorrect recycling costs taxes.
I received a leaflet about what can be recycled in my area. It also explained the process which interested me. I think more education is needed.

Children are the future this will help them recycle correctly or even improve the system.
attributes.additional_details:
School is where we learn life skills, preparing us for adulthood. Recycling is currently not as efficient as it could be because the public are not fully educated. Personally I've attended beach cleans, researched where to recycle electronics / printer parts / clothes... It is all difficult to follow.

If schools had one lesson a year dedicated to recycling.
Maybe an expert from the industry could visit, they would learn the common mistakes of recyclers. Some would see it as a career path.

attributes.action: Require local councils to issue parking charges by recorded delivery
attributes.background: Sending PCNs by 2nd class postage does not guarantee delivery to home addresses and as a result quite often representation or appeal of the contravention is missed. Recorded delivery would eliminate this issue and the cost should be added to the original PCN meaning no cost to the council.
attributes.additional_details: There are many instances on multiple forums of people experiencing this exact issue. It’s unfair to not have received the original letter on time and as a result the fine being multiplied and even in some cases warrants issued to bailiffs. I personally didn't receive the first PCN letter and the fine was £65, now the fine is £195 as a result of not receiving the 2nd class letter sent out by the local council. Is this fair or just a money making loop hole by the councils.

attributes.action: Improve the number and quality of care homes
attributes.background: Many children in care experience multiple placements, in some cases going to 8 or more different care homes. This is because care homes either shut down or get too full, so a large number of children in care have nowhere to go and end up on the streets, increasing child poverty numbers.
